title: Creates a retired military personnel license plate
summary: Creates a retired military personnel license plate; such distinctive plate would include the words "U.S. armed forces retired" and the person's branch insignia.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                          719

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                      (PREFILED)

                                    January 5, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  ROBACH -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Transportation

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to  creating  a
         distinctive license plate for certain retired military personnel

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The vehicle and traffic law is  amended  by  adding  a  new
    2  section 404-x to read as follows:
    3    S  404-X.  DISTINCTIVE  PLATES FOR CERTAIN RETIRED MILITARY PERSONNEL.
    4  1. ANY RETIRED MILITARY PERSONNEL, RESIDING IN THIS  STATE  SHALL,  UPON
    5  REQUEST,  BE ISSUED A LICENSE PLATE BEARING THE WORDS "U.S. ARMED FORCES
    6  RETIRED" AND SHALL HAVE THE INSIGNIA OF THE MILITARY  BRANCH  THAT  SUCH
    7  PERSON  SERVED IN ON THE LEFT SIDE OF THE LICENSE PLATE. APPLICATION FOR
    8  SUCH LICENSE PLATE SHALL BE FILED WITH THE COMMISSIONER IN SUCH FORM AND
    9  DETAIL AS THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PRESCRIBE.
   10    2. THE DISTINCTIVE PLATE AUTHORIZED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL  BE
   11  ISSUED  UPON PROOF, SATISFACTORY TO THE COMMISSIONER, THAT THE APPLICANT
   12  SERVED IN THE MILITARY.
   13    3. A DISTINCTIVE PLATE ISSUED PURSUANT TO THIS SECTION SHALL BE ISSUED
   14  IN THE SAME MANNER AS OTHER NUMBER PLATES UPON PAYMENT  OF  THE  REGULAR
   15  REGISTRATION  FEE PRESCRIBED BY SECTION FOUR HUNDRED ONE OF THIS ARTICLE
   16  PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT A ONE TIME  FEE  OF  FIFTEEN  DOLLARS  SHALL  BE
   17  CHARGED  FOR  SUCH PLATE.  SUCH ANNUAL SERVICE CHARGE SHALL BE DEPOSITED
   18  TO THE CREDIT OF THE DEPARTMENT  OF  MOTOR  VEHICLES  DISTINCTIVE  PLATE
   19  DEVELOPMENT  FUND  ESTABLISHED  PURSUANT TO SECTION NINETY-FIVE-G OF THE
   20  STATE FINANCE LAW AND SHALL BE USED FOR PRODUCTION, DESIGN,  ADVERTISING
   21  AND MARKETING OF CUSTOM LICENSE PLATES.
   22    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   23  it  shall have become a law. Effective immediately, the addition, amend-
   24  ment and/or repeal of any rule or regulation necessary for the implemen-
   25  tation of this act on its effective date are authorized and directed  to
   26  be made and completed on or before such effective date.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD01935-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to creating a distinctive license plate for certain retired military personnel
